Repository 
  public Repository(String filename,
                    boolean writeAlso,
                    boolean mustExist,
                    Repository nextRepository) throws RepositoryAccessException, IOException
Constructs a Repository given a filename.
Parameters:
fileName - Path to the Repository file. Please note that the filename argument may well change to an EReadableFile object. Maybe we will provide both possibilities. If the filename is given as path1;path2;path3 then a chain of linked repositories is constructed automatically with path1 as the frontmost repository file and path3 the hindmost.
writeAlso - If true, then we also allow writes to the file. If false, then the Repository is opened read-only.
mustExist - If true, we throw an IOException if the file is missing.
nextRepository - The next Repository file in the Repository path. If a key cannot be found in a Repository file, then its nextRepository is searched, etc. If more than one repository pathname was given in the first (pathname) argument then the nextRepository will be linked in after the last one of the repositories opened from the filename arguments.
Repository 
  public Repository() throws RepositoryAccessException, IOException
Default constructor. Opens a writable repository with the default name.
Repository 
  public Repository(EEnvironment eEnvironment) throws RepositoryAccessException, IOException
Environment-based constructor. Currently this is quite simple - it checks for an environment property named "repository" and if given, uses that as the pathname for the repository file, and if not given, it uses the default repository name. The value of "repository" can be a list of multiple pathnames separated by semicolons - if given as path1;path2;path3 then a chain of linked repositories is constructed automatically with path1 as the frontmost repository file and path3 the hindmost.

put 
  public void put(Object key,
                  Object object) throws RepositoryAccessException
Simplest way to store an object in the Repository using a specific key. It will throw an RepositoryAccessException if the Repository is not writable.
put 
  public void put(Object key,
                  Object object,
                  RtEncodingParameters parameters,
                  Hashtable properties) throws RepositoryAccessException
Stores an object into the Repository under the given key object. The parameters (an RtEncodingParameters device, similar to a hash table) and properties (a Hashtable) arguments are used when encoding the object. It will throw an RepositoryAccessException if the Repository is not writable.
Parameters:
parameters - An RtEncodingParameters collection of Objects (as keys) and token objects (typically Strings) as values. When encoding the object, any object that can be found in the parameters collection gets replaced by its corresponding token.
properties - A hashtable of information that is made accessible to the Encode() routine of object that Encode and Decode themselves rather than using the standard encoder.
putHash 
  public byte[] putHash(Object object) throws RepositoryAccessException
Stores an object into the Repository using the cryptographic hash of the data as a key. It returns that key as a byte array. It will throw an RepositoryAccessException if the Repository is not writable.
Parameters:
object - The object to save in the Repository using an automatically generated key.
Returns:
The generated hash key used (a byte array).
putHash 
  public byte[] putHash(Object object,
                        RtEncodingParameters parameters,
                        Hashtable properties) throws RepositoryAccessException
Stores an object into the Repository under the cryptographic hash of the data as a key. It returns that key as a byte array. The parameters (an RtEncodingParameters collection) and properties (a Hashtable) arguments are used when encoding the object. It will throw an RepositoryAccessException if the Repository is not writable.
Parameters:
object - The object to save in the Repository using an automatically generated key.
parameters - An RtEncodingParameters collection of Objects (as keys) and token objects (typically Strings) as values. When encoding the object, any object that can be found in the parameters collection gets replaced by its corresponding token.
properties - A hashtable of information that is made accessible to the Encode() routine of object that Encode and Decode themselves rather than using the standard encoder.
Returns:
The generated key used (a byte array).
put 
  public GenSymKey put(Object object) throws RepositoryAccessException
Stores an object into the Repository under a freshly generated GenSymKey. It returns that GenSymKey. It will throw an RepositoryAccessException if the Repository is not writable.
Parameters:
object - The object to save in the Repository using an automatically generated key.
Returns:
The generated key used (a GenSymKey).
put 
  public GenSymKey put(Object object,
                       RtEncodingParameters parameters,
                       Hashtable properties) throws RepositoryAccessException
Stores an object into the Repository under a freshly generated GenSymKey. It returns that GenSymKey. The parameters (an RtEncodingParameters collection) and properties (a Hashtable) arguments are used when encoding the object. It will throw an RepositoryAccessException if the Repository is not writable.
Parameters:
object - The object to save in the Repository using an automatically generated key.
parameters - An RtEncodingParameters collection of Objects (as keys) and token objects (typically Strings) as values. When encoding the object, any object that can be found in the parameters collection gets replaced by its corresponding token.
properties - A hashtable of information that is made accessible to the Encode() routine of object that Encode and Decode themselves rather than using the standard encoder.
Returns:
The generated key used (a GenSymKey).
get 
  public Object get(Object key)
Simplest way to retrieve an object stored under a given key. Searches the Repository for the given key. If not found, it will continue searching the Repositories behind it in the Repository path. If found, returns the object stored under that key. If the key is not found in this Repository or in any Repository in the Repository path behind this Repository, null is returned. The parameters (an RtDecodingParameters collection), if given, is used when decoding the object. If the object in the Repository requires a parameter token/value pair (to be substituted for an object that was pruned when encoding the object) but either no parameters collection was given, or it does not contain an entry for the parameter, then null is returned. If the object could not be decoded for any other reason, then null is returned.
Parameters:
key - A key to search for, any non-null object but most often a String.
Returns:
The retrieved object, or null (if key was not found). You may need to cast the return object to your target data type.
get 
  public Object get(Object key,
                    RtDecodingParameters parameters) throws RepositoryAccessException, RepositoryNeedParameterException, RepositoryKeyNotFoundException, FileNotFoundException
Searches the Repository for the given key. If not found, it will continue searching the Repositories behind it in the Repository path. If found, returns the object stored under that key. If the key is not found in this Repository or in any Repository in the Repository path behind this Repository, then a RepositoryKeyNotFoundException is thrown. The parameters (an RtDecodingParameters collection), if given, is used when decoding the object. If the object in the Repository requires a parameter token/value pair (to be substituted for an object that was pruned when encoding the object) but either no parameters collection was given, or it does not contain an entry for the parameter, then a RepositoryNeedParameterException is thrown. If the object could not be decoded for any other reason, then a RepositoryAccessException is thrown.
Parameters:
key - A key to search for, any non-null object but most often a String.
parameters - An RtDecodingParameters collection of token objects (typically Strings) as keys and Objects as values. When decoding the object, any parameter token that is encountered in the Repository is looked up in the parameters collection and gets replaced with the value found there.
Returns:
The retrieved object. You may need to cast the return object to your target data type. May return null if the value stored was null.
getOne 
  public Object getOne(Object key)
Searches a single Repository for the given key. If found, returns the object stored under that key. It will not search further in the Repository path. If the key is not found in this Repository, null is returned. If the object could not be decoded for any reason, then null is returned.
Parameters:
key - A key to search for, any non-null object but most often a String.
Returns:
The retrieved object, or null (if key was not found). You may need to cast the return object to your target data type.
exists 
  public boolean exists(Object key)
Checks whether a given key exists in a Repository. If found, returns true, otherwise it will check the other Repositories in the Repository path. If the key cannot be found anywhere, it returns false. No attempt is made to decode the object.
Parameters:
key - A key object to check existence for.
Returns:
true if the key was found and null otherwise.
existsOne 
  public boolean existsOne(Object key)
Checks whether a given key exists in a specific Repository file. If found, returns true, else returns false. It will not search further in the Repository path. No attempt is made to decode the object.
Parameters:
key - A key object to check existence for.
Returns:
true if the key was found and null otherwise.
isWriteable 
  public boolean isWriteable()
Returns true iff the Repository is writable. Does not follow the Repository path.
Returns:
true if the Repository is writable and null otherwise.
finalize 
  public void finalize()
Called at garbage collection time. Closes the Repository.
delete 
  public boolean delete(Object key) throws RepositoryAccessException
Deletes a record (key and its value) from the Repository. Follows the Repository path and deletes all occurences in writeable Repository files. Note - You may have to store a null under a a certain key to hide an entry if one exists in a read-only Repository in the path.
Parameters:
key - A key object identifying the record to be deleted.
Returns:
true if something was successfully deleted and false otherwise.
deleteOne 
  public boolean deleteOne(Object key) throws RepositoryAccessException
Deletes a record (key and its value) from one Repository file. Does not follow the Repository path.
Parameters:
key - A key object identifying the record to be deleted.
Returns:
true if something was successfully deleted and false otherwise.
willEncodeObjectAsClass 
  public String willEncodeObjectAsClass(Object obj)
Part of RtEncodingManager interface implementation. Returns null

  public void encodeObject(Object obj,
                           RtEncoder coder)
Part of RtEncodingManager interface implementation
idForUniqueExportedObject 
  public int idForUniqueExportedObject(Object object)
Part of RtEncodingManager interface implementation. Returns 0.
uniqueExportedObject 
  public int uniqueExportedObject(Object object)
Part of RtEncodingManager interface implementation. Returns 0.
decodeObject 
  public Object decodeObject(Class theClass,
                             RtDecoder coder,
                             int index)
Part of RtDecodingManager interface implementation. Returns null.
handleMissingParameter 
  public Object handleMissingParameter(Object paramObj,
                                       RtDecodingParameters parameters) throws RtDecodingException
handleMissingParameter - Part of RtDecodingManager interface implementation. This method is called when a parameter object is found in the stream but the parameter object did not have an entry in the (reverse) decoding parameter hashtable. Here in the Repository we treat the case that the parameter object is a GenSymKey specially - we look up the genSymKey and the result is added* to the parameter hashtable so that future lookups will work without failing.
Parameters:
paramObj - - An Object that was encoded and labeled as a parameterObject in the stream. It can be any kind of object but this method treats GenSymKeys specially.
parameters - An RtDecodingParameters collection of token objects (typically Strings) as keys and Objects as values. When decoding the object, any parameter token that is encountered in the Repository is looked up in the parameters collection and gets replaced with the value found there.
Returns:
The retrieved object, or null (if key was not found). You may need to cast the return object to your target data type. Note that RtDecodingManagerDefault never returns anything, it throws one of two different error messages - that's one reason we don't use the default here.
handleClassFault 
  public Class handleClassFault(String className)
Part of RtEncodingManager interface implementation. Returns null.
getUniqueObject 
  public Object getUniqueObject(int id)
Part of RtEncodingManager interface implementation. Returns null
uniqueImportedObject 
  public void uniqueImportedObject(Object object,
                                   int id)
Part of RtEncodingManager interface implementation
needToStoreTypes 
  public boolean needToStoreTypes()
Part of RtEncodingManager interface implementation. Returns false.
elements 
  public synchronized Enumeration elements()
Returns an enumerator to access all records for debugging purposes. In the future it will either be removed using a CPP directive or will some certain debugging capability
Returns:
An enumeration containing all keys in the Repository. Does not return certain system entries such as the TypeTable.
commit 
  public void commit()
Commit changes to the Repository. You need to call this after you have made changes to make those changes permanent in the Repository. Note that changes you've made without committing them are considered part of the repository and will be returned if you request them; they are just not permanent and will disappear if you quit without calling commit().
close 
  public void close()
Closes the Repository. Note that closing without first calling commit() will discard all your changes.
Overrides:
close in class GenericDB
noteNewClass 
  public void noteNewClass(String className,
                           int classCode)
